intro: Dichelostemma capitatum, commonly known as the blue-eyed bulb. It is a flowering plant native to California and is characterized by its striking blue-violet flowers that bloom in late spring. The plant has a bulbous root system and is part of the Amaryllidaceae family. Its leaves are narrow and grass-like, forming a rosette at the base. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in open woodland or grassland habitats.
